data.title: Trump says he is having dinner Friday with Apple CEO Cook
data.text: U.S. President Donald Trump said he was having dinner on Friday with Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook of Apple Inc, a company the president has criticized for not manufacturing more of its products in the United States.

data.title: Trump says Apple is spending 'vast sums of money in the U.S.' and he's having dinner with the CEO
data.text: Trump's tweet comes a day after Apple put out a press release describing the money it spends on U.S.-based suppliers and vendors.

data.title: Apple says it's responsible for 2.4 million jobs in the US
data.text: Yet, it can still take forever to get an appointment at the Genius Bar.

data.title: Apple Watch Drives Wearables Surge in North America in Q2
data.text: Total wearables shipments jumped 38% to 7.7 million.

data.title: AirPods, Smartwatches Are 'Moving The Needle' For Apple
data.text: While some Apple investors fret about declining iPhone sales, wearables are beginning to pick up the slack. One Wall Street analyst sees big opportunities for AirPods and the Apple Watch.

data.title: Apple software hints at September 10 announcement for the next iPhone
data.text: An image in Apple's iOS 13 beta release to developers could offer a clue to its fall event date where it is expected to announce its newest iPhones.

data.title: Apple to fight $14BN EU tax battle in court next month
data.text: Apple and Ireland have been denying the EU's tax bill has merit since 2016.
